episodeTitle: To Save Her Friends! Mocha Runs at the Risk of Her Life!
japaneseTitleRomanized: Tomodachi o Mamoru! Mocha Inochi-gake no Tōsō
japaneseTitle: 友達を守る！モチャ命がけの逃走
description: Mocha desperately runs away with the dangerous NHC10 candy to prevent her fellow captive children from consuming it. In a heroic act of self-sacrifice, she eats all the candy herself to save her friends. Meanwhile, the Straw Hat crew works to protect the children from harm as Luffy and Momonosuke escape from a garbage chute, and Zoro carries Tashigi while fleeing from Caesar's poisonous gas.

events.title: Mocha Steals the NHC10 Candy
events.description: After learning that the candy containing NHC10 will eventually kill all the children, Mocha makes the brave decision to steal all the candy and run away with it, preventing the other addicted children from consuming it.
events.significance: This moment establishes Mocha as a heroic character willing to risk her own safety to protect her friends, setting up the episode's central conflict.

events.title: Chopper, Nami, and Robin Protect the Children
events.description: The Straw Hat crew members work together to prevent the addicted children from catching Mocha and taking the deadly candy. They use their abilities to restrain and protect the children from harming themselves.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Straw Hats' commitment to protecting the innocent children despite the difficulty of restraining them without causing harm.

events.title: Nami Uses Milky Ball
events.description: Nami demonstrates her weather manipulation technique 'Milky Ball' to create clouds that obscure vision and help control the situation with the children.
events.significance: Shows Nami's strategic use of her Clima-Tact abilities in a non-combat situation focused on protection rather than attack.

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami uses her technique to help restrain the children

events.title: Robin Uses Cien Fleur: Dos Mano
events.description: Nico Robin employs her Hana Hana no Mi ability 'Cien Fleur: Dos Mano' (Hundred Flowers: Two Hands) to create multiple hands to gently restrain the children.
events.significance: Showcases Robin's precise control over her Devil Fruit powers, using them delicately to protect rather than harm.

quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin uses her ability to hold back the children

events.title: Mocha's Ultimate Sacrifice
events.description: Cornered by the other children and unable to escape, Mocha makes the heartbreaking decision to eat all of the NHC10 candy herself, sacrificing her own life to prevent her friends from consuming the deadly drug.
events.significance: This is the emotional climax of the episode, demonstrating incredible courage and selflessness from a 9-year-old child. It deeply affects the Straw Hats and shows the horrific consequences of Caesar's experiments.

quotes.text: I'm sorry everyone... I have to do this to protect you!
quotes.speaker: Mocha
quotes.context: Mocha's resolve before eating all the candy

events.title: Chopper's Medical Dilemma
events.description: After Mocha's overdose, Chopper faces an impossible choice: use his limited sedatives to calm the other rampaging children or save Mocha who is dying from the massive overdose.
events.significance: Highlights the cruel nature of Caesar's experiments and shows Chopper's dedication as a doctor facing an impossible triage situation.

events.title: Luffy and Momonosuke Escape Garbage Chute
events.description: Luffy and the unconscious Momonosuke manage to escape from the garbage chute where they had fallen, encountering some of Caesar's subordinates in hazmat suits.
events.significance: Reunites Luffy with the main action and sets up his confrontation with Caesar's forces.

events.title: Luffy Uses Conqueror's Haki on Caesar's Subordinates
events.description: Luffy demonstrates his Conqueror's Haki (Haoshoku Haki) to instantly knock out multiple hazmat-suited subordinates of Caesar, demanding to know Caesar's location.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's growth and mastery of Haki after the time skip, using it strategically to eliminate weak opponents without wasting time fighting.

events.title: Zoro and Tashigi Flee the Poison Gas
events.description: Zoro carries Tashigi while running away from Caesar's deadly poison gas (Shinokuni) that is spreading through the facility. They work to meet up with the rest of the group.
events.significance: Shows the ongoing threat of the poison gas and the unusual alliance between pirate Zoro and Marine Tashigi.

quotes.text: I'm sorry everyone... I have to do this to protect you!
quotes.speaker: Mocha
quotes.context: Mocha's resolve before eating all the candy to save her friends

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami uses her weather technique to help restrain the children

quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin uses her ability to hold back the children

themes.description: The episode centers on Mocha's incredible act of self-sacrifice, showing that heroism isn't limited by age. A 9-year-old girl willingly risks her life to save her friends from a deadly addiction.
themes.symbolism: The candy represents both the temptation and danger of addiction, while Mocha's choice to consume it all represents taking on suffering to protect others.

themes.description: The children of Punk Hazard represent the victimization of the innocent, forced into addiction and dangerous experiments by Caesar Clown's cruel ambitions.
themes.symbolism: The children's enlarged bodies symbolize how they've been robbed of their childhood and normal development through scientific exploitation.

themes.description: Chopper faces a heartbreaking triage decision, highlighting the moral complexity doctors face when resources are limited and every choice means someone suffers.
themes.symbolism: Chopper's medical bag and limited sedatives represent the constraints of medicine when facing overwhelming tragedy.

characterSpotlights.development: Mocha demonstrates extraordinary courage and selflessness, evolving from a scared captive child to a hero who sacrifices herself for her friends. Her willpower to resist the NHC10 addiction long enough to make this choice showcases her inner strength.
keyActions: Steals all the NHC10 candy to prevent other children from taking it
Runs through the corridors while being chased by addicted children
Makes the ultimate sacrifice by eating all the candy herself
Suffers severe overdose symptoms but achieves her goal of protecting her friends
quotes: I'm sorry everyone... I have to do this to protect you!

characterSpotlights.development: Chopper is forced to confront the limits of his medical abilities when faced with multiple critical patients and limited resources. His anguish shows his deep compassion and dedication to his role as a doctor.
keyActions: Chases after the children trying to prevent them from harming themselves
Faces the impossible choice between sedating the rampaging children or saving Mocha
Struggles with the emotional weight of Caesar's cruel experiments

characterSpotlights.development: Nami shows her maternal instincts and strategic thinking, using her abilities to protect the children non-lethally while showing deep concern for Mocha's wellbeing.
keyActions: Uses Milky Ball to help control the situation
Works with Robin and Chopper to restrain the children safely
Shows emotional distress over Mocha's condition

characterSpotlights.development: Robin demonstrates her precise control and gentle nature, using her typically combat-oriented abilities for protection and restraint instead.
keyActions: Uses Cien Fleur: Dos Mano to restrain children without harming them
Coordinates with Nami and Chopper to manage the crisis
Shows compassion for the children's plight

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows his growth post-time skip by efficiently using Conqueror's Haki to deal with obstacles, demonstrating his determination to confront Caesar.
keyActions: Escapes from the garbage chute with Momonosuke
Uses Conqueror's Haki to knock out Caesar's subordinates

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the chase sequences with the children pursuing Mocha, adding more dramatic tension and showcasing the desperation of the addicted children.
Additional scenes of Luffy and Momonosuke navigating the facility were added to pad the episode runtime.

trivia.fact: This episode aired on September 29, 2013, during the Punk Hazard arc which introduced many elements that would become crucial to the overall One Piece storyline.
Mocha's height of 692 cm (22'8½") makes her taller than most adult humans in the One Piece world due to Caesar's gigantification experiments.
The NHC10 drug used on the children is one of the darkest elements in One Piece, representing real-world issues of drug addiction and the exploitation of children.
This episode aired during the period when One Piece did not use ending themes (from episode 279 in 2006 until 2023), allowing for longer episode content.
